data.name: Fortran for beginners: splitting
data.description:
You are given strings all of same length and of the same form.
They contain numeric and non-numeric substrings. 
Each numeric substring is formatted in a 10-width field and has 2 decimals (some are in scientific format)
and is followed by a letter which represents a unit, except the 4th one (4.99E+19 in the example 1) below).

Example 1): ```s = "Fs.     169.00K Sn.   4.73E-02G Th.   8.00E+00S Fo.   4.99E+19 Fv.     676.00H"```

Given an integer `n (1 <= n <= 5)` and a string `s` the function `solve` returns the nth numeric number in any real form.

Example 1): ```solve(4, s) returns the REAL number 4.99E+19 or 4.990000E+19 ...```

Example 2): 
s = ```"Fs.     224.00K Sn.   3.49E-05G Th.   7.81E-03S Fo.   4.88E+16 Fv.       0.88H"```

```solve(5, s) returns the REAL number 8.80E-01 or 0.880000 ...```.

The tests will check if ```ABS(expect - actual) < 1E-6```.

# Note

To better see blanks they have been replaced below by `-`

`"Fs.-----169.00K-Sn.---4.73E-02G-Th.---8.00E+00S-Fo.---4.99E+19-Fv.-----676.00H"`.
